name: @local/app
author: <akauppi@gmail.com>
--: -- following stuff matters for development, only --

scripts.test: if port-is-taken --silent 3000 ; then cypress run ; else npm run _test_1 ; fi
scripts._test_1: concurrently --kill-others --success=first -n dev,cy "npm run dev:local" "wait-for 3000 && npm run -s test"
scripts.ci:test: concurrently --kill-others -n dev,test "npm run -s ci:dev" "wait-for 4000 && cypress run ${CYPRESS_RUN_FLAGS}"
scripts.ci:dev: concurrently --kill-others-on-fail -n emul,init "npm run --silent _ci_dev_local_emul" "npm run -s _dev_local_init && npm run -s _dev_local_vite"
scripts.dev:local: concurrently --kill-others-on-fail -n emul,init "npm run _dev_local_emul" "npm run _dev_local_init && npm run _dev_local_vite"
scripts._dev_local_emul: npm run -s _checkPort4000 && $(docker-run-cmd) firebase emulators:start --project=demo-abc | grep -v -E "Detected demo project ID|You are not currently authenticated|You are not signed in"
scripts._dev_local_init: wait-for 4000 && firebase-prime --project=demo-abc local/docs.js local/users.js | grep -v -E "Do not use with production credentials"
scripts._checkNoLinks:
check-no-links || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: 'npm' links not allowed in a production build. Use them only at development.
	Use 'npm list' to see them; 'npm unlink x; npm install' to remove.
"; false)
scripts.//_checkStaging:
[[ -f ../../firebase.${ENV-staging}.js ]] || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: '../../firebase.${ENV-staging}.js' is missing; see 'README.md' on how to create one.
"; false)
scripts._checkPort4000:
port-is-free --silent 4000 || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: Port 4000 is taken. You might have left the backend server running (hint: use this for both).
"; false)

prettier: > when Prettier is installed or updated, it’s strongly recommended to specify the exact version in package.json: "2.3.0", not "^2.3.0".
sass: Needed if you use '<style scoped lang="scss">' in your styles.

/not/ firebase: It's important we don't list 'firebase' as a peer dependency. Doing so would force 'app-ops-deploy' to pull in
*all* the sub-packages (most of which are unnecessary).
Instead, root defines the version and both us and 'app-ops-deploy' pull in the necessary '@firebase' modules, directly.

| grep -v: Do *not* chain multiple 'grep -v's. That causes output to be completely hidden, for some reason.
